text: Tap at the brewery - even though I lived in Bamberg I never noticed Spezial has a beer not smoky. not very common to drink here among the locals. slightly hazy golden color, white head. quite high carbonation. malty, some floral hops. good, average franconian Landbier.

Draught at Akkurat. Light hazy deep golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of grain, floral hops, earth, bread and light yeast. Taste is very light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of grain, bread, floral hops and earth. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome.

Keg @Brauerei Spezial, Bamberg. 07-08-2016.
Pours quite hazy golden with frothy white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Malty, DMS nose. Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is malty, sweet, herbal, little fruity. Some bitter finish.
Cloudy golden with medium white head. Aroma is herbs, toast, light hops. Taste is easy going hop bitterness with fresh sounress. Good carbonation, refreshing, easy. Really nice!
At Spezial. Hazy orange beer, small head. Aroma is grains, malt. Taste is the same, sourbitter. not bad.
Tap at the brewpub. Herbal and spicy, medium body with a decent carbonation, and wide in taste and flavour. Juicy. A balance to die for. So simple, yet not boring at all. Yum.

On tap at Brewery.
cereal, smoke, herbs, golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2017 At the brewery. Hazy glowing orange appearance with creamy white head. Aroma is hay, crackery, bready yeasts, dough, light Fruchtgummi/bubblegum, grassy. Taste is straight bread dough, herbal hops, with a touch of Fruchtgummi and a grassy bitter finish, all with a silky smooth naturally carbed body. A Kellerbier delight.

Tap @ The brewery. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of grass, citrus, light grains, a touch of bread malts, light honey, very fresh and clean nose. Taste is medium bitter with a good malty taste - Biscuits and crackers. Grassy, hop forward and clean.
Kühl und frisch vom Fass in der Brauerei getrunken. 5 Stunden Busfahrt hat sich gelohnt.

Hazy, yellow-golden colored, medium white head, OK lacing. Aroma is of malt, grainy, bready yeasty, straw. Taste is medium- sweet malt, quite grainy, some bready dough, caramel, some hay and straw, light+ bitterness, dry finish. Light bodied, average carbonation, bit watery. Decent but missing body...
Rich, earthy, full. Wheat, dough, green grass and herbs. Great beer from an amazing brewery.
On draft. Hazy golden color with one finger head. Taste is mostly earthy, pretty good beer though and easy to drink.

(Draught at In De Wildeman, Amsterdam, 18 Feb 2015) Pale golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with bread, grass and hay. Malty taste with notes of bread, cereal, hay and a balanced grassy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Fresh, really tasty and in very good balance. Nice one.

On tap at In de Wildeman. Clear, pale straw yellow with a medium large, creamy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, grassy and slightly fruity aroma of straw, cereals, some caramel and citrus. Sweetish, grassy and slightly fruity taste of straw, cereals, caramel and citrus, followed by a short, slightly bitter, grassy finish. Thin to medium body, smooth mouthfeel, flat. Tastes super fresh and is very quaffable. Enjoyed it!

Draft at Brauerei Spezial in Bamberg during the Post-Christmas Bamberg Jolly of January 2014. Pours lightly hazy yellow with a fluffy white head. Rich dry cereal in the nose, some floral hops. Light sweet flavour, super clean, with crispy cereal, mellow bitter straw, slight grass. Light bodied with average carbonation and creamy texture. Very good balance in the finish, more crispy cereal and offsetting bitter hay and grass. Glorious beer. Supremely drinkable
Poměrně sluné německé (rozuměj standardní) pivo, bez jakýchkoliv nedostatků, ovem takové tady jsou skoro vechny (v Bambergu). Na druhou stranu to není nic výjimečného...

Look; off white head, normal lacing and beautiful hazy gold golden body. Aroma; fine nice malts, toffee, bread, hops, very inviting. Taste; nice solid blend of hops into malts, bread, grains, caramel, butterscotch, faint peat - leading to a fruity finish with hops, spices, roasted malts. Good texture and soft-normal carbonation. Superb brew, cold, fresh, clean, tasty. Dank sei Gott! They should tap and sell some bottles to Bierothek of this Ungespundet. This beer is not printed on regular menus, only mentioned on a price list on a door in a hall, so when I asked for "oongeshpoondet", the frau asked "raookhbeer", but I answered "nine, noor oongeshpoondet bitte", and followed her recommendation for "shlowferlah" which is very tasty and delicious and pared the beer perfectly. Top notch! [50cl 4.9% vom Faß @ Brauerei Spezial [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */]
Draught at the brewpub. Shady golden, medium white head. Bready aroma, hay, herbal hops. Medium bodied,soft carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.

Dalla botte a caduta in birrificio.
Ambrata torbida con bella schiuma.
Corpo medio, carbonazione piacevole.
Secca, malto finale erbaceo con una punta di citrico.

Gravity keg at Spezial brewery in Bamberg-Germany. Pours an unfiltered golden dark color, crazy off white cap which stays tick forever. Nose: white milk bread, fresh herbal accent, after rain green garden, flowers. Mouth: soft carbonation which makes it extremely drinkable, herbal spicy note in the aftertaste, fresh and balanced lager. Crisp, tea-like end, super thirst quenching. Hard to forget its distinctive softness. I am shaking!

February 11, 2015. On cask at Akkurat. 
Hazy orange with a dense white head. Aroma is grain, citrus, floral and light unfermented wort notes. Taste is medium sweet grainy with a soft light grassy and herbal crispy bitterness in the finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.

Keg at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Hazy golden, rich firm head. Citrus, bread and grass up front. Dry with light-medium body and crisp, rounded mouthfeel. Grass and citrus, slender bready malt. Salty bitter finish. Straighforward, correct and quite entertaining, but doesnt click entirely with me.

Draught @ Wildeman, Amsterdam.
Clear yellow gold, finely bubbled white head. Hard candy, malts and mild hop end. Subtle and delicate. Start with it.
On tap at the Brewpub. Leicht trübes goldenes Bieer mit einer schönen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch kräftig malzig, leicht grasig, hopfig. Geschmack würzig malzig, leicht grasig, sehr lecker!
(Bue à la brasserie): Leffervescence est contrôlée, le corps moelleux habité par une franche résine. Les céréales sont croquants et machables, une autre belle offrande de Spezial.

Vor Ort in Bamberg gezischt. Es sieht zwar fein aus - voller Leben, hell und prickelnd, doch offenbart es eine langweilige Seele.Die Aromen tendieren in Richtung Butter und etwas Vanille, zum Schluss komt etwas Limette hinzu. Abschluss ist bitter, unausgewogen. Durchschnittsbier mit Hoehen und Tiefen.

On tap at their brewpub. The beer pours out in a hazy yellowish-golden colour with steady head and medium body. Aroma of hay and hops. Taste of fresh hops, hay, straw, mild fruits and mild bread. Hints of barley and malt. Refreshing and very good. Enjoyed it.

Dalla botte a caduta. Colore giallo dorato, torbida, schiuma non eccessiva anche se abbastanza persistente. Aroma fragrante di fiori di campo, frutta gialla, miele millefiori. Al palato scorre con una beverinità assoluta, corpo medio, nel finale lascia un amaro avvertibile ma molto bilanciato che richiama il sorso successivo...ed ecco che in due minuti il boccale è finito...

Draught at the brewpub. From old notes. Very nice, unsmoked and unfiltered beer. Fruity and yeasty, relatively light and refreshing. Very good, although you should try it first, as the flavor is much more subtle than the rauchbier.

Vom fass at the brewpub. Very pale yellow pour with light haze, tenacious white foam. Aroma is grainy, very lemony, light grassiness. Taste is grainy, legit kellerbier, a bit yeasty, light grassy notes, nice and fresh, citrusy as well. Palate is light, low carbonation. Good, but I prefered the smoked lager.
Wundabar!!! La migliore birra di tutta bamberga! Da bere a ogni ora del giorno e della notte! Note erbacee, floreali... Lunica pecca?! Si trova solo in due posti al mondo...

Bamberg jolly day 2 25/01/2014. Draft at the Brewpub bamberg. Clouded yellwo straw coloured pour with a big frothy white head. Aroma is really nice lemoney zest hops, some wet grass, silage. Flavour is fresh grassy floral nobel hop. Solid assertive grassy bitterness. Palate is full and slight creamy and grainy. Properly good stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 Bamberger Bierwochenende, Bier Nr. 6. Vom Faß im Spezialkeller, Bamberg (mit schönem Blick auf die Altstadt). - Zitronengelb, nur leicht trüb. Nase und Antrunk schön zitronig-hopfig, leicht blumig. Mildes Malz. Sehr angenehmes, mineralisch-kreidiges Mundgefühl, leicht trocken. Schwach rezent, wie es sich für ein Kellerbier gehört; enorm süffig. Im Abgang grasige Hopfenbittere, mittlerer bitterer Nachtrunk. Paßte hervorragend zum Rauchfleisch mit Bohnakern. - Ausgezeichnetes, mildes aber keineswegs dünnes, fruchtig-hopfenaromatisches Kellerbier.  =============================  
Nachtrag: Bei einer zweiten Verkostung noch wesentlich intensiver gehopft, mit kräftigem Heu und frischem Gras von der Nase bis in den Nachtrunk. Außerordentliches Kellerbier.

25th January 2014Bamberg Bash Day 2. On tap at the delightfull brewpub. Hazy pale gold beer. Small white head. Palate starts smooth but has a light minerally crispness. Light floralness and light bitterness. Touch of peel before the semi dry finish. Tasty little number.

How: Draught.
Where: At the brewpub.
Appearance: Hazy yellow colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, malt, hops.
Body: Medium body and low carbonation.
Flavour: Mild citrus, hops, caramel, sweet malt.

Day 2 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, tap at Spezial Bamberg, 25/01/14. 
Hazed golden yellow with a good size off white head.
Nose is grassy, clean, light citrics, soft bread dough, faint hops.
Taste comprises lemon rind, grass, bread dough, light mandarin, orange, touch of hops.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, grassy closure.
Nice clean drinker with a citric tang ringing throughout.
Solid.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draught at the brewpub. Hazy pale golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Malty fruity aroma, bready, cereal notes, grassy, cream, vanilla notes. Malty biscuit flavor, fruity, citrus, grassy, cream, caramel, earthy notes, floral notes. Hugely drinkable.
Hazy golden body with a nice white head.malty aroma.taste is malty bread,crispy,slightly bitter.

On tap at the brewery. Cloudy yellow with a lasting white head. Clean malty aroma with herbal hops. Crisp malty flavour with expressive herbal hops, with a hint of citrus. Good, very hoppy finish and aftertaste, perhaps with a hint of smoke

On tap at the brewery, cloudy yellow with a lasting thin white head and faint aromas of lemon and bread. Initially spicy and yeasty, but then the excessive acrid bitterness takes over and swamps the rest.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Bamberg. Head: off-white foam. Colour: hazy, yellow golden. Aroma: hops, malt. Taste: mild bitter. Palate: refreshing, sparling mild bitter. Overall: nice
On tap at the brewpub. Pours cloudy yellow with nice white head. Aroma is malt, hay. Flavor ismalt, hay, grass, yeast. Very nice.

On tap at Spezial Keller, Bamberg. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet grainy malts, fresh grass and yeasty. Taste is very well balanced, weak sweet malty, crisp and dry hops, very good and a surprisingly good one.
Draught at Brauerei Spezial, Bamberg, Germany. A hazy yellow coloured pour with a healthy white head on top. Hoppy, malty aroma. Tastes malty, yeasty, slightly hoppy.

Draught at Spezial, Bamberg. Hazy yellow color, and a thick, lacing white head. Mild smoke aroma, and yeast is prominent in the aroma as well. Crisp and bitter. Dry grain finish, with a faint mineral quality. Excellent Keller.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 On tap at the keller in Bamberg.  Cereal and noble hops.  So intense it?s unlike any lager I?ve had.  Some smoke.  It?s bloody lovely.  Speechless.  I am without speech.  Had it again the following day and just as good. Re rate 29 09 2015. In the pub in town. Having had thus several times over several years this is amazing. Yeasty  hoppy. Drinkability off the scale.  Faultless.
Draft at spezial. Traw colored pour, hay, grassy, light lemon citrus notes. Wonderfully made, what a yellow beer should be

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2016 Draught at the Spezial Brauhaus. - Very surprising, fresh and hoppy unfiltered Pils, - in the midst of all those other rauchy options. Full, citrus&floral hop-pregnant and proteine-rich, full of fresh aromas and flavours. The go-to beer if you are: 1) visiting Spezial for the Rauchbier and bringing along someone who doesnt enjoy liquid pork...chances are theyll be drinking the best beer of the evening, and their Rauchbiere arent bad either... 2) Have had enough of Fässlas Helles right across the street!
Id almost subscribe to last raters "Prima Pils more attractive twin sibling" statement if it werent unfair to Victory, as they also export in bottles (which strangely tasted better than on draught...)! - - Rerate 2016-03: several draught pours: almost creamy mouthfeel, fresh herbal lemonade with a good touch of earthy bread and tasty yeast touch. Immensely sessionable.

Draught at Spezial in November, 2011 (on the hill): Lightly hazed chartreuse. Creamy, beaming-white head. Vibrantly hopcentric nose of lemon and pepper with accompanying sea air, haylike pils malt, and spruce tips. Wonderfully pungent, perfumey and elegant.  Pillowy carbonation. Very natural in texture. Highly quaffable from the start as hops immediately unleash their  herbal and spicy bitterness amid a salty mineral tinge which accentuates the dryness. Mild toastiness is present, though the malt is very clean with a feathery delicateness. Very complex and elegant hop character soars and zings with a minty and spicy interplay along with lots of  bright grassiness and lemon zest bitterness. Champagnelike. Plenty of nectar to cover the palate and deepen the sharper, more herbaceous hoppiness. Trace lemon candy sweetness, but predominantly bright and zesty with some sprucelike accents, to boot. Rustic yeast signature adds heft to the core. Pils malt provides a beautifully sharp, firm, and dry crackery base. Closes dryly malty and staunchly mineralic with light a flowery succulence but largely zippy and vivaciously peppery with resounding lemony afterthoughts. A dazzling example of liquid harmony. Has pretty much everything I love about Franconian brewing, from the luxurious display of Tettnanger  and skillfully extracted pils malt right down to the pronounced yeast bite. This is Prima Pils more attractive twin sibling.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Tap @ Spezial, Bamberg. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of bready malt, grass, citrus. Flavor of malt, bread, grassy hops, citrus. Thin body, lively carbonation.  Nice and refreshing beer. 090812

Draught @ the brewery. Pours golden, almost yellow, semi hazy, with a white head. Notes of orange and citrusy washing detergent in the aroma. Very fresh taste with notes of orange cest and a citrusy bitterness. The citrus notes makes it refreshingly crispy. Quite heavy carbonated. Super drinkable. Light and refreshing.
Tap @ brewery in Bamberg. hazy yellow appearance with a white head. Super grainy/husky, yeasty, rich pale malty aroma. Bready, quite floral hoppy, rich yeasty, very husky grainy flavor. Very nice!

Draught at the brewpub. Poured a nice hazy yellow-gold body witha a white head. Slightly sourish nose, sweetish and herbal, somewhat grainy in a rice cracker sort of way. The taste is just... sublime, flowery, smokey, relatively balanced. Damn, with some more body this would be insane, like this its just very good.

On draft at the Spezial pub on the hill (by the beer garden) Nov 2011.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is hazy medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (cereal, toasted grain), moderately hoppy (resin, herbs), lightly yeasty (dough), with notes of kumquat and honey.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation.

I have mixed feelings.  Its got a vibrant, fresh nose, but the resinous/green hops and sour fruit aspects arent to my tastes.  I couldnt get as excited about this as Jeff, but its a nice brew to be sure.
Draught at the brauhausCloudy blond color. The aroma is a bit stale, sourish. The flavor is boring; its just more bitter than the average. Maybe not fresh, but for sure I didnt enjoy it much.

Herb-süffiger Antrunk mit nebensächlichem Hopfen. Die Herbe ist dabei extrem trocken und breitet sich im Mittelteil aus. Recht herb bleibend, nie aber bitter. Sehr süffig, stark getreidig und blumig. 10/11/11/10//11

Draught at both keller and pub. Pleasant, very drinkable helles with a slight indefinable perfume that I hadnt encountered before. Fairly heavy palate and comparatively kind hoppiness. Almost impossible to pronounce after a few glasses.

Draught at the brewpub in Bamberg. Barrel gravity pour. Hazy blond color with a creamy white head. A little piney on the nose with creamy malt. Somewhat hoppy flavor (noble) and a nice smooth maltiness. Spritzy carbonation; almost distractingly so. Finished with some light, lingering sweet malt and bitterness. The mouthfeel just seemed oddly abrasive for some reason, which is odd considering the gravity pour. Boggles the mind.
On tap at Brauerei Spezial, Bamberg. Poured goldenyellow with an off-white head. Aroma is a bit fruity and grassy. Flavour is somewhat bitter and a bit fruity.
Draft at Spezial. Hazy yellow body and a large creamy diminishing off-white head. Aroma of fresh hops, yeast and white bread. Nice, tasty and refreshing.

Smells fresh, quite yellow. Flavor is somewhat pale lagerish at the start, but with a very dry pils finish. A nit of fruit perhaps, but certainly no smoke like the other two. Light and excellent, just like this brewery.

On tap at Spezial brewpub.
Appearance : Hazy yellow with creamy head.

Aroma : Nice malt, a bit citrusy. Some herbal hops.

Taste : Malt and herbal hops. Slightly citrusy. Finish is quite malty. Some spices. Quite bitter.

Overall : Nice malt. nicely citrusy. Very fresh. Great beer.
Bevuta alla Spezial di Bamberga; è una keller meno carbonata del solito, con un delicato amarognolo finale. Buona

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Color yellow with small head. Aroma light hop, bread. Taste hop, grass.

Cycled into town (Bamberg) from our campsite just outside at Bug 17-06-10 had this on tap at the brewery tap  Pours lemony yellow with a white head. Nice hoppy beer with a steady bitterness, the finish is dry and clean. Refreshing with some lemon flavours.  A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov13  3.4

Draft.  Hazy apple juice body with off-white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, spice, some caramel/bread.  Taste is medium sweet, caramel, spicy, some grassy, light grapefruit.  Light-medium body, light acidity.

Hello from Bamberg. Nutty, corny malt nose with a trace of dusty hops. Hazy yellow gold with thin white foam. Refreshing dry flavor with a friendly shove of rough hop bitterness. A real quaffer with some rugged character.
Clear golden with a large white beige head. Sweet aroma with malty and caramel notes. Flavour was quite malty with caramel, grassy hops and smoke. Picked up some sourness as well.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 Vom Holz @ Spezial. Light bitter yeasty fruity nose. Dark yellow cloudy, off-white lace. Bitter hoppy edges, light minerals to balance the fruity chewy malt body perfectly. Süffig.

Draft @ brewery. Is bright yellow, slightly hazy. Thick, lasting beige head and scattered lacing. Yeasty aroma is sweet with damp earth and wet grain. The body is good with moderate carbonation and a fresh bitter finish. Is better-hopped than it let on. Fun to drink.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2013 Tap @ Brewpub. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy white head and lacings. Nose is fresh. Yeast , straw, and hops. Medium bodied - smooth. Crisp and dry. Quaffable. Re-Rate July-13. Fresh from tap. Grassy and citrussy. Mild bready malts. Really love. 3,6-3,9

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Yellow colour, mediumsized foamy white head. Aroma is yeast, malts, earth and hops. Flavour is sweet malts, caramel. All-in-all being rather sweet along with some slight grassyness to balance it up a bit.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2010 Hazy dull straw.  Thick white foam.  Fresh, straw taste with a herbal bitterness.  This has a more delicate character than most of the style and a dry finish. That said, it is a highly enjoyable brew.  Spezial U has grown on me over the course of repeated tastings.  Where it lacks the strong mineral character of many other Franconian country(style) brews, it certainly lacks not for a nice hop aroma and a very moreish finish.  It is actually becoming my go-to beer at Spezial.

(draught at the Spezial Gaststätte, Bamberg) pours a hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of lightly grainy pale malts, honey, floral and herbal hops and light yeast. flavour is the same, with lovely flowery hops. medium body and carbonation.

Draft at brewery.
My expectations for this beer were very high. I love a good kellerbier and was frankly disappointed by this one. Despite the name it wasn’t special. Well made, yes, but not outstanding.  Perhaps it is because I had the smoked lager first. Another trip to Bamberg is necessary.

Draft - Darker golden body, very slight hazy body, white head; Very fresh nose that is hard to take apart; Malt bitter body with some sparkle, very balanced to the almost boring; Long malt bitter finish with a very little malt aroma. The hop is strangely enough very apparent the the finishing burb.

On draught at the brewpub. 
Light cloudy golden colour with creamy head. Fruity backbone in aroma with traces of yeast. Pretty dry beer with hops noticed but only lightly bitter, if any bitterness at all. Pretty vague flavour profile but very clean.

(6/31/08) Draught at the brewpub in Bamberg. Cloudy appearance (it actually looks like there are clouds there!) with a big white head. Aroma of some malt and nice fresh hoppiness. A rather dry hoppy flavor with some grass and some citrus notes. Medium-bodied. Very nice.

On tap at Spezial Beergardens, Bamberg. Yellow gold with white head. Hoppy sweet beer, perfect for the heat in the beer garden, quite still with a wheaty, grain type note and a hint of tartness. Fresh and tasty, its good to get a hop kick.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2009 Mug at the brewery in Bamberg.  Mostly clear dark yellow body with a white head.  Up front its sweet but turns to semi-sour, husky grains over the middle in a hurry.  Medium tartness, yeast grains and wheat germ flavors all around.  Fresh tasting but it has some mold in the nose at times, resembling soggy bread.  Lightly crisp, lightly sweet.  Nice overall.


rerate in 2009, seems kind of bland and boring.  simple, sweet, body was lacking structure and depth.  rating lowered from 3.7 in 2008.

From tap at the brewery. Steinkrug.  The aroma has light floral and malty notes. The flavour has a light sweetness and a light bitterness with a refreshing, slightly dry citrus note and some caramel. Its nice and OK, but also somewhat anonymous.

Dark yellow colored, slightly hazy appearance. Medium sized white head. Yeasty, flowery, cellary aroma, still rather clean one, maybe some cardboard comes up. Medium bodied. Flavor starts also as sweet one with fruits and lemon, paper and cardboard in drying aftertaste. Dryness lasts with hops, crispy carbonated palate.

On tap at the brewery on 6/7/07: Pours a hazy golden with a wispy-lacing white head.  Aroma of fresh, earthy grassy hops and light pale malt.  Body starts fairly full with nice carbonation and good, lightly sweet pale malt along with big floral earthy herbal hops.  Nicely balanced, full-bodied and refreshing.

Draft. A slightly hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet malty with a light citrusy touch. The flavor is sweet malty - and very clean German, but also a bit boring, leading to a dry and slightly bitter finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ tap, Bamberg
Hazy orange color, creamy steady white head. Lemony, grassy aroma. Lemony-fruity flavor, very citrusy, almost herbal lager. Crisp, refreshing beer with hoppy aftertaste.

On tap @ the brewery. Aroma of soft hops, citron and some grapefruit. Hazy, golden coloured with a thin, white, lasting head. Taste is a bit sweet and bitter with some hops and citrus. Not too watery, dry. Nice.
Rating #2000. One of the best kellerbeers, at the origin of German beer: Bamberg. Hazy orange golden color, short head. Aroma of soft hop, bit fruity. Soft bitter taste, bit sweet, dry. Good balance.

Draught @ Spezial. Citrus aroma, light yeasty. Hazy yellow color with a white foamy head. Fruity, light yeasty flavor. Citrus and grapefruite notes. Fresh, thirst quentching. Dry end. Fruity, tasty beer.

Draught @ Spezial Keller. Hazy golden color with a average off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, sweet, grass, herbal. Flavor is moderate bitter and bitter with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Draught at the brauhaus. Light hazy orange golden colour with a big white head. Herbal, grassy, malty aroma and a sweet malty, herbal, light grassy, hoppy taste. Medium body with a dry herbal finish.

(On tap) Slightly hazy amber golden with a dense, off-white head. Soft, malty aroma. Medium-bodied, sweetish malty - perhaps a wee touch of caramel, but otherwise fairly neutral without much bitterness. Decent but boring. 081106

Draught at the brewery. Hazy golden with a creamy offwhite head. Faint sweet malts aroma with a hint of hops. sweet maltiness in the lead, dry finish. Good mouthfeel. Above the average lager (but not much more).

Vom fass @ Spezial, Bamberg, Germany.
One of the last beers I got to taste before heading out of this wonderfully picturesque, almost unspoilt town, before continuing south to the states beer capital - München.
Into a stein glass. Hazy, straw-gold in body. Very finely, intermittently carbonated, rising to a half inch of sticky,  condensed white foam that held out and laced wildly down the glass. Aroma, like all Kellerbiers, was complex but this one was more definable than others. Damp, mown grass pierced the ol-factories first before waning to reveal some fresh chopped herbs, ripe fresh squeezed lemon and limes, and a waft of gritty, dusty pale malts underneath. In the mouth it is soft but full of life, inkling and entering every corner of the mouth like it owns the palate. A wonderfully gripping base of summer malts settles in first, before some ripe, tart and tight fruits and the sweeter edges of mango and grapefruit make themself comfortable. Body is light but firm and it is rather smooth, even creamy as it heads for the tonsils and then south. A little sour malt shines across the sides of the tongue. In the back it has a depth of spicy, grassy and herbal hop tones that give it a nice bitter, biting edge before it drops off with a long malt and hop swallow that has just a little more fruit. Very quenching stuff. It remains good for the length and seems to get more complex as it warms showing some pine-nuts, pale honey and peat on the tongue that linger well as it goes. Lovely stuff, one to surely bring pale lagers up a notch. A superb Kellerbier.
Draught at the brewery, a cloudy gold with a large think white head. A hoppy aroma, both slightly floral and grassy. A good clean mouthfeel, some yeast with the sweet floral flavours.
Draught @ Spezial. Hay and honeyed malts with a slight grassy edge to the hops. As I drank this became slightly more herbal and almost citric. Well balanced and goes down very nicely.
Draught. Hazy golden colour, small white head. The flavour is citricly fruity with a hint of teaish bonbon. OK bitterness in aftertaste, late and nice. Good mouthfeel.

Draught @ Spezial.  Cloudy, golden U with a creamy, rocky head.  Huge aroma, yeast, some barnyard chalk, unidentifiable funk, wheat.  Very dry, very malty, lots of funk and character.  Creamy medium body, end bitterness, a mix of sourness and bitterness in the middle.  Some chalkiness, slight herbiness.  Way too complex for the style.  I think this has the potential to be rather bland after a while, but it has good character.  Bit of breadiness, too.  Layered, just needs a bit more body and a bit more kick.  Hoppy end, good, worthy Seidla.

At the brewery tap  Creamy, off-white head.  Almost no lace.  Sligtly hazy, golden body.  A fresh aroma of flowers, orange, lemonade, ... Theres a medicine, called lycomucil, that smells like.  Very well balanced fruity flavour.  Lightly sweet, moderately bitter.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2017 Impressions from the Gaststätte:
-A sticky foam recedes to a ring on the cloudy golden brightness.
-A few love handles in the mouthfeel, tons of wet hay to bite into, aided by the natural carbonation of course.
-Herbal hops and cereals just understated enough; mind you, the mouthfeel is so comfortable they must be in awe.
-Finishes pretty softly, with herbal hop flavors and bitterness, although slightly higher levels would have been lovely.
-This landbier could not be better balanced. This is a fantastic piece of fresh bread. Another high quality product from Spezial.

On tap at the brewery a few times.

Malt, coriander and pepper aroma; bitter taste wirh pepper, wood and citrus aroma; bitter finish with spice, butter and hop aromas.
A very pleasant hoppy beer with a nice blancing butteriness. Their only unsmoked beer.

Enjoyed many a half liter at the brewery pub in Bamburg, Germany. This beer is an unfiltered pils, and similar to St. Georgen Brau Kellerbier. This beer pours to a opaque, pale golden color with a white head that fades, and a soft carbonation. The nose on this beer is very inviting with herbal/grassy hop aromas, and hints of crisp pilsner malt. The palate is soft and round with good pale malt flavors, on a smooth and drinkable body.  Spezial Ungespundet finishes with good pilsner malt flavor up front, then ends with a nice grassy hop bitterness that lingers. This beer is outstanding, very fresh, and very flavorful tasted on draught at source. It was a great beer to enjoy with a lunch of sauerkraut and bratwurst.

(bottle) Hazy golden colour with a rather small sized foamy head. Slightly sweet malty nose with a fruity and yeasty tinge with a distinctive herbal hoppy note. Bitter flavour, medium body, smooth mouthfeel. Dry malty and slightly fruity taste with herbal hops, long lasting bitter and dry hoppy finish. Very good.

Bottle (bought at the brewery): Hazy, visible carbonation (?), thin but firm white head; sweet malty, grainy and dusty nose, a tinge of caramel and a touch of barrique, too, rounded by the aroma of hops; moderate bitter flavour, creamy mouthfeel; long and lingering hoppy aromatic finish with a distinctive touch of grains and a very, very faint touch of smoked malts in the background. Superb, great stuff. One of the best in good, old Franconia !
(On tap @ the brewpub) Hazy, yellow colour. Ok head. Nice fruity aroma. Tasty and fruity flavour with a nice bitterness.

Hazy dark yellow with creamy white head. Aroma filled with orange marmalade - nice! The flavor is mild fruity and again some marmalade kicking in, followed by chewing gum and pepper - very complex for a German lager. Lightly bitter with acidic finish that ends with a slight burn - almost chili like.Well balanced and pleasant, and by far the best from Spezial.

Tap, at the brewpub. Jan 2005. Hazy gold, moderate white head and low condition. Sweet yeasty nose with background hops and a delicate lemon citrus twist. Solid malt and hops with fruity yeast in the mouth and chalky in the finish with lingering hop bitterness. Not a trace of smoke.

Malty, sweet and lightly earthy aroma, some nice brown sugar notes amidst  herbal hoppiness.  Deep, dark copper color with a fairly slight head and sparse lacing.  Flavor is primarily malty and sweet with hints of dark caramel and butterscotch, but towards the finish spicy, almost vegetative hops are noted, also a light amount of bitterness.  Mouthfeel is smoothly effervescent, body is medium.  Highly drinkable and complimentary to the Schinken mit Ei.

This was a suprise. You expect a smoked beer, but its not. This is a blond beer with a very pleasant taste of hops (dryhopping?). There are very different tastes in this beer but hop is the that stands out the most.

Pours a huge, frothy head. Cloudy with bits of yeast floating. Milk and cheese in the aroma. Very complex flavor with oak, chesse, hops, vanilla and a hint of smokiness. Very unusual, but well made and pleasant lager.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2013 tried to pick a good one for my 1000th rating. dont know if i would call this a smoked but thats not important. this has a potent belgian triple candi aroma with orange mango juice in there. very full and tasty and finally, after a long wait, bitter. icecream mouthfeel. salty and dry finish. fruit salad, iced coffee, there is so much in this beer. re-rate: when i first tried this in bamberg in 2002, i gave this a 4.7. now i can see that i was being stingy. not much i would change about that first rating except bumping up the numbers. on tap at spezial with the famous house schaeuferla and kloss, this is pure indulgence. extra marks must also go for the fact that this beer was still so full of flavour straight after downing a litre of schlenkerla urbock

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2003 amazing complex spicy hoppy smell, like westmalle tripel or something. main flavour here is the really full hops - really spicy, peppery, herbal, salty, bitter and dry finishing. texture is beautifully creamy but light. i don't know if this is supposed to be smokey like the others - i couldn't taste much smokiness. but who cares, it's a beautiful beer.
